r5adla.description:
ADLs (Activities of Daily Living) include:
- Bathing
- Dressing
- Eating
- Toileting
- Transferring (e.g., getting in/out of bed)

Higher values indicate greater difficulty, increasing hospitalization risk.

values.5: Some difficulty with all five ADLs

r5adltot6.description:
ADLs (Activities of Daily Living) include:
1. Bathing
2. Dressing
3. Eating
4. Toileting (using the restroom)
5. Transferring (e.g., getting in/out of bed)
6. Continence (control over bladder/bowel function)

Higher values indicate greater difficulty, increasing hospitalization and long-term care needs.

values.6: Some difficulty with all six ADLs

r5iadlfour.description:
IADLs (Instrumental Activities of Daily Living) include:
1. Managing medications
2. Shopping for groceries and essentials
3. Handling transportation (driving/public transport)
4. Managing finances (paying bills, budgeting)

Higher values indicate greater difficulty, increasing dependency and hospitalization risk.

values.4: Some difficulty with all four IADLs

r5nagi8.description:
The NAGI Disability Scale assesses physical function limitations and includes:
1. Walking a short distance
2. Climbing stairs
3. Stooping, kneeling, or crouching
4. Lifting or carrying heavy objects
5. Reaching overhead
6. Pushing or pulling large objects
7. Standing for long periods
8. Sitting for long periods

Higher scores indicate more significant physical limitations and a greater risk of hospitalization or disability.

values.1: Some difficulty with one NAGI task
values.2: Some difficulty with two NAGI tasks
values.3: Some difficulty with three NAGI tasks
values.4: Some difficulty with four NAGI tasks
values.5: Some difficulty with five NAGI tasks
values.6: Some difficulty with six NAGI tasks
values.7: Some difficulty with seven NAGI tasks
values.8: Some difficulty with all eight NAGI tasks

r5grossa.description: The Gross Motor Scale assesses major movement-related limitations.

values.0: No difficulty with gross motor tasks
values.1: Some difficulty with one gross motor task
values.2: Some difficulty with two gross motor tasks
values.3: Some difficulty with three gross motor tasks
values.4: Some difficulty with four gross motor tasks
values.5: Some difficulty with all five gross motor tasks

r5mobilsev.description: The 7-item Mobility Scale assesses difficulties in essential mobility functions.

values.1: Some difficulty with one mobility task
values.2: Some difficulty with two mobility tasks
values.3: Some difficulty with three mobility tasks
values.4: Some difficulty with four mobility tasks
values.5: Some difficulty with five mobility tasks
values.6: Some difficulty with six mobility tasks
values.7: Some difficulty with all seven mobility tasks

r5uppermob.description: The Upper Body Mobility Scale assesses difficulties in upper body movement.

values.0: No difficulty with upper body mobility
values.1: Some difficulty with one upper body mobility task
values.2: Some difficulty with two upper body mobility tasks
values.3: Some difficulty with all upper body mobility tasks

r5lowermob.description: The Lower Body Mobility Scale assesses difficulties in lower body movement.

values.0: No difficulty with lower body mobility
values.1: Some difficulty with one lower body mobility task
values.2: Some difficulty with two lower body mobility tasks
values.3: Some difficulty with three lower body mobility tasks
values.4: Some difficulty with all lower body mobility tasks

r5fallnum.description: Number of falls in a given period
